fields.System.Title: CUTs IM04042525 Gliwice MR L-Spine User: Easy Reading Layout: no yellow slice possition line visible for all orientations.

fields.System.Description:
1

What sis the Problem:

CUT: MR L-Spine User
for example pat id 14404 - study from 18..11.16
customer is opening WF MR L-Spine User: and drag and drop the needed series inside the easy reading layout.

--> with the button "show hide line" from the tool selection the reference line can be done visible and this function is selected in our case.

--> inside the Tra view and the Cor view - the system is showing the slice position as a yellow line when you scroll through the images.
--> but this is not working for the Sag view.
Customer would expect to see the position on the cor images when scrolling on the sag view
--> but this line never shows up.

see screenshots attached.

 

When does it occur:

WF MR L-Spine USer
Easy reading layout.

 

What has been done so far:

see screenshot attached..

reproducible on the server every time
- with the public and siemens default easy reading layout.

fields.System.History: DefectExchange: External Defect SYN.2183336 from DB SYN was set to state Qualified.
fields.Siemens.IKM.AdditionalInfo:
This Defect is duplicated from 2032765, due to the following reason: To track the issue at MR..

Reason the attribute was added:
The attribute “FramesPerpendicularityEnsuredByApplication” was added to the MR DRSplugin with CS:221346 as a fix for the defect: 640591.

Here the “scrolling configuration ""SortingbyCategory ALONG_AXIS"" is not working in MR workflows for default layouts.”

The issue in the above defect was that the FrameSorter from SY Imaging has an assumption that ALONG_AXIS sorting/scrolling is only allowed for volume related data,
as a consequence the DIP configured ALONG_AXIS sorting is not applied for the default layouts.

To fix the above issue:
A new attribute “FramesPerpendicularityEnsuredByApplication” was introduced , so that sorting would be made ,even if the volume is not available.

Also I have attached the mail communication which has defect discussion with SY and MR.

fields.Siemens.Defect.CustomerImpact: 2D reference lines are not shown in certain circumstances after creating a layout with easy reading D&D.
fields.Siemens.Defect.Justification: Deepak Srinivasan: Kindly export the defect to Imaging team :HC SI DC SVK IMG(already discussed with SY imaging team)
fields.Siemens.Defect.ProposedSolution:
DESCRIPTION OF SOLUTION: The attribute is misleading to be considered for the scout evaluation.
Hence the attribute from the IsScout method needs to be removed.

RESOURCE/UI/ADOC Change:NA

ELH/EPH/EDS/EUT/EIT/ESR Change:NA

AFFECTED REQUIRMENT KEYS / EGA KEYS:NA
fields.Siemens.Defect.RequestCCB: MR_CCB_syngo.via_SMRB20A_HFxx, 2017-04-06:Duplicate for 2032765 to track the issue at MR. Please provide the solution for VB20A HF02
fields.Siemens.Defect.RootCause:
The source document and target document are considered as Scout images, since in MR DRSPlugin we are adding the “FramesPerpendicularityEnsuredByApplication” attribute for documents which has volume.

The bouding box calculation returns vector3d which is not satisfying the overlapping condition for 2D ref lines, the bounding box calculation depends on the IsScout Method.
fields.Siemens.Defect.TestingConcerns:
Are new tests recommended?
Are new regression tests needed?
